sentence.idiomatic: You're a long way off from retirement!
He doesn't run nearly as fast as I do!
My Chinese is not nearly as good as yours!
I am very disappointed with his work performance.
I didn't receive his gift, I'm very disappointed.
This city isn't as good as I imagined it would be. I'm a little disappointed.
Let's break up, and not hurt each other anymore.
Everyone learn together, help each other, and enjoy it.
The most important thing for lovers is that they trust each other.
I came to China to be with my girlfriend.
In order to have a good body, I stick to a daily workout routine.
In order to get promoted he practically killed himself working overtime.
Hello, can I sit here?
Sure, nice to meet you.
I'm also really glad to meet you.
Your Chinese is very good.
Not at all!
How long have you been to China?
I've been in China for more than two years. I'm studying Chinese.
Oh, you are learning Chinese?
I want to work in China, so I need to learn Chinese.
Oh. I think Chinese is very difficult for you. How do you feel this bar?
It's not bad. It's just that nobody will speak Chinese with me, so I'm a little disappointed.
Ha ha! You are very serious!
